title: Train services on coastal line delayed
byline: The train services on the coastal line have been delayed due to a train breaking down at Payagala owing to a technical failure, the Department of Railways said.

title: Showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Laugfs Gas to resolve shortage within next few days
byline: Laugfs Gas PLC has announced that the current shortage of Laughs gas cylinders in the market will be resolved within the next two days.

title: Postal voting for 2024 General Election to commence tomorrow
byline: The postal voting for the upcoming General Election 2024 is set to commence tomorrow (30).

title: Gaza aid fears as Israel bans UN Palestinian refugee agency
byline: Israel’s parliament has voted to pass legislation banning the UN’s Palestinian refugee agency (Unrwa) from operating within Israel and Israeli-occupied East Jerusalem, within three months.

title: New contractor appointed for supply of LPG to Litro Gas Company
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for awarding the contract to M/s OQ Trading Limited for the supply of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) to Litro Gas Company for the year 2025.

title: Extraordinary gazette issued for prevention of African Swine Fever spread
byline: A gazette extraordinary has been issued declaring every Divisional Secretariat Division of Sri Lanka to be an infected area or suspected area for African Swine Fever (AFS) and Porcine Reproductive and Respiratory Syndrome (PRRS).

title: Govt’s borrowing only within approved limits, reassessment planned after polls - Dr. Nalinda Jayathissa
byline: Dr. Nalinda Jayathissa, an executive member of the National People’s Power (NPP), emphasized that the recent loans obtained by the government have been strictly within the limits approved by Parliament.

title: Railway Station Masters to launch immediate trade union action
byline: The Railway Station Masters’ Association has decided to launch an immediate trade union action, over issues pertaining to the post of Railway Station Master.

title: New govt. has not printed any currency notes, Minister clarifies
byline: The new government has neither printed any currency notes nor obtained loans from any foreign institution, Minister Vijitha Herath claims.

title: Petition against IGP appointment: SC allows naming ex-President Ranil as respondent
byline: The Supreme Court has allowed naming former President Ranil Wickremesinghe as a respondent of a petition filed challenging the appointment of Deshabandu Tennakoon as the Inspector General of Police (IGP).

title: No funds allocated for public service salary increase, govt. says
byline: Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Vijitha Herath confirmed that no funds have been allocated to increase salaries for public sector employees, contrary to the previous government’s announcements.

title: Johnston’s illegal luxury car: 2 more suspects surrender to CID
byline: Two more suspects have surrendered to the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) in connection with the case against former Minister Johnston Fernando over the illegally acquired BMW car.

title: Intelligence on Arugam Bay attack is not foreign influence against the county - Minister
byline: Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Vijitha Herath says that a foreign intelligence agency provided information to Sri Lanka’s State Intelligence Service (SIS) about a planned attack in the country, and the security measures were taken accordingly.

title: Immediate measures to resolve salary disparities of Teacher Advisors’ Service, court told
byline: The Attorney General (AG) informed the Supreme Court that immediate measures will be taken to pay the salaries of the Sri Lanka Teacher Advisors’ Service after resolving disparities in their salary scales.

title: 2 suspects granted bail in Johnston’s illegal luxury car case
byline: The two suspects who surrendered to the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) in connection with the case against former Minister Johnston Fernando over the illegally acquired BMW car, have been granted bail.

title: Hezbollah elects Naim Qassem to succeed slain head Nasrallah
byline: Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said on Tuesday it had elected deputy head Naim Qassem to succeed slain secretary general Hassan Nasrallah, who was killed in an Israeli air attack on Beirut’s southern suburb over a month ago.

title: TID submits confidential report to court on Arugam Bay investigation
byline: The Terrorism Investigation Division (TID) has informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court that two suspects, who were arrested concerning the investigations carried out according to the intelligence received regarding a plan to launch a terrorist attack targeting a tourist attraction in Sri Lanka, will be detained further for interrogations.

title: Public alerted over surge in fake messages on WhatsApp and other social media
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SL CERT) today issued an alert to the public about the surge in fake messages being disseminated via social media and communication platforms, particularly WhatsApp.

title: Lost Mayan city found in Mexico jungle by accident
byline: A huge Maya city has been discovered centuries after it disappeared under jungle canopy in Mexico.

title: ASPI reaches highest value since Feb. 2022
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange has gained 135.54 points today (29).

title: Businessman barred from sharing defamatory info against ex-State Minister on WhatsApp
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has issued a conditional injunction on a businessman from Mannar, preventing him from circulating defamatory information targeting former State Minister Kader Masthan on social media platforms including WhatsApp.

title: Sri Lanka’s Central Bank responds to reports of ‘money printing’
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) today rejected as ‘completely baseless’ the recent reports claiming that the CBSL has printed currency notes to the value of Rs. 100 billion through Sri Lanka’s open market operations.

title: President assures decisive economic measures to protect banking sector and entrepreneurs
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized that, since neither he nor his administration has special ties or obligations to any party within the country’s development or business sectors, they are positioned to make decisions impartially and decisively for the sake of national economic recovery.

title: Cache of T56 bullets found on Maradana-Beliatta train
byline: The railway security officers at the Beliatta Station have discovered a stock of 57 bullets used in T56 assault rifles inside a backpack left under a seat in a compartment of a train operating from Maradana to Beliatta.

title: Railway Station Masters to launch strike from midnight tomorrow
byline: The Railway Station Masters’ Association warns that they will launch a strike action starting from midnight tomorrow, if their demands are not met during the discussion with the subject minister which is scheduled to be held tomorrow (30).

title: India-Sri Lanka Joint Working Group discusses mutually acceptable and long-lasting solution for fishermen issue
byline: The 6th meeting of the India-Sri Lanka Joint Working Group (JWG) on Fisheries was held today (29) in Colombo.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle, Matara and Mannar districts.

title: PUCSL to request additional information from CEB on electricity tariff revision
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced that it will take steps today (28) to inform the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to request additional information regarding the electricity tariff revision.

title: Two arrested with large stock of commercial explosives in Padaviya
byline: Padaviya Police Station has arrested two suspects who were in possession of a stock of commercial explosives.

title: Japan’s government in flux after election gives no party majority
byline: The make-up of Japan’s future government was in flux on Monday after voters punished Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s scandal-tainted ruling coalition, leaving no party with a clear mandate to lead the world’s fourth-largest economy.

title: Notorious drug trafficker ‘Bakery Jana’ arrested in special operation
byline: An organized criminal and large-scale drug trafficker, known as ‘Marvin Jana’ or ‘Bakery Jana,’ has been apprehended in Sri Lanka after successfully evading security forces for some time.

title: Youth killed in motorcycle collision in Kumbukwewa
byline: A 19-year-old youth in the Kumbukwewa in Neriyawa has been killed in an accident on the Kumbukgate - Bannakgama Nelawa road last afternoon (27).

title: Train services on Northern Line resume
byline: The train services from Colombo Fort to Kankasanturai have officially resumed today (28).

title: President to receive report on national rice and paddy stocks today
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) is set to deliver the report on the current stocks of rice and paddy available in Sri Lanka to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (28).  MORE…

title: President reveals number of Cabinet Ministers to be appointed after polls
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake underscored the urgent need for a political overhaul to steer the country toward genuine progress. Highlighting the growing public disillusionment with politics, he labeled the current political landscape as tainted by unethical practices.

title: Train services on coastal line disrupted due to derailment near Kompanna Veediya
byline: The train services on the coastal line have been disrupted, owing to a derailment of a train near the Kompanna Veediya railway station, the Department of Railways said.

title: Gammanpila challenges Minister Herath to prove allegations against Easter attack investigative committee’s chair
byline: In a press conference held today (28) at the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) party’s headquarters, former MP Udaya Gammanpila challenged Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Vijitha Herath to substantiate the allegations of misconduct against retired judge S.I. Alwis.

title: India-Sri Lanka Joint Task Force to convene in Colombo to address fisheries disputes
byline: The Indo-Sri Lanka Joint Task Force will hold its sixth meeting tomorrow (29) at the Mahaweli Center in Colombo, as confirmed by M. P. N. M. Wickramasinghe, Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Fisheries.

title: Dilith Jayaweera says committed to building a respectable public service
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance and Gampaha District parliamentary candidate, entrepreneur Dilith Jayaweera says that he and his team are dedicated to creating a respectable public service.

title: Passport queues re-emerge
byline: Since early morning, long queues have formed outside the passport office in Battaramulla as people await tokens for obtaining passports, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: PM Harini responds to ex-President’s claims on public sector salaries
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that despite former President Ranil Wickramasinghe’s claims about a Cabinet decision to raise government employees’ salaries, the proper procedures were not followed when taking the decision.

title: CSE emerges as second best performer in Asia
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has been placed as the second best performing equity index in Asia.

title: ‘There is no travel ban on Sri Lanka’ – US Ambassador
byline: U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung has clarified that the United States has not issued a travel ban on Sri Lanka and that the security alert issued recently was only for Americans to avoid the Arugam Bay area until further notice.

title: Once illegal, famous Japanese alcohol Doburoku is making a comeback
byline: Japanese-produced whisky, nihonshu (sake), and beer are popular around the world.

title: Trump’s social media company has tripled in value in five weeks
byline: Trump Media & Technology Group is losing money, generating very little revenue and its main product Truth Social remains a relatively small player in social media.

title: Nishantha Perera to be appointed Elpitiya PS chairman?
byline: The equal distribution of seats between the National People’s Power (NPP) and opposition parties will have no effect on maintaining the activities of the Elpitiya Pradeshiya Sabha, according to former Election Commission Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya.

title: Egypt proposes 2-day truce in Gaza, release of 4 hostages
byline: Egypt’s president says proposal would see talks resuming within 10 days of two-day truce to forge permanent ceasefire.

title: Sri Lanka Railways addresses safety concerns on Maho-Omanthai line
byline: The Department of Railways has issued a statement addressing recent concerns regarding the safety of the railway line between Maho and Omanthai, following claims from trade unions that the line posed risks to passengers.

title: President stresses need to strengthen National Procurement Commission
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized the importance of implementing a procurement plan and strengthening the National Procurement Commission (NPC).

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of showers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa, North-western and Northern provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Govt Tamil schools in two provinces closed on Friday
byline: All government Tamil medium schools in the Central and Uva Provinces will remain closed on November 01 (Friday) following the Deepavali holiday on October 31.

title: Postal voting for 2024 General Election begins
byline: The postal voting for the upcoming General Election 2024 has commenced today (30).

title: Six Bangladeshis arrested without valid visas
byline: Six Bangladeshi nationals who were residing in the country without valid visas in violation of immigration and emigration regulations have been arrested in the Amandoluwa area of Seeduwa.

title: Deepavali festival allowance raised by Rs. 10,000
byline: In celebration of Deepavali, a significant festival for the Tamil community, the Sri Lanka State Plantations Corporation has increased the annual festival allowance by Rs. 10,000.

title: 86 train derailments so far this year
byline: There have been 86 train derailments during the time elapsed so far this year (2024).

title: Canada alleges Indian minister Amit Shah behind plot to target Sikh separatists
byline: The Canadian government alleged on Tuesday that Indian Minister of Home Affairs Amit Shah, a close ally of Hindu nationalist Prime Minister Narendra Modi, was behind the plots to target Sikh separatists on Canadian soil.

title: 2024 A/L exam to be held as scheduled
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations Amith Jayasundara urges students appearing for the 2024 Advanced Level examination to download the official schedule exclusively from the Examination Department’s website.

title: Former Minister Johnston Fernando produced before court
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando, who was remanded over the incident of a luxury vehicle allegedly belonging to him found parked at a star-class hotel premises, has been brought to the Fort Magistrate’s Court for the trial this morning (30).

title: E-8 visa agreement unlawfully signed by former minister - SLBFE
byline: The Chairman of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) Kosala Wickramasinghe disclosed that the E-8 visa agreement with South Korea was signed unlawfully by the former minister, without obtaining Cabinet approval or proper government authorization.

title: Apple set for biggest revenue jump in two years on iPhone demand in China
byline: Apple is expected to report its biggest quarterly revenue jump in two years on Thursday, with iPhone demand faring better than recent years toward the end of the company’s annual release cycle, especially in China.

title: Johnston Fernando released on bail
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando, who was arrested and remanded over the unregistered luxury vehicle allegedly belonging to him found parked in a star-class hotel premises, has been granted bail.

title: Bangladesh and Sri Lanka to expedite negotiation on PTA
byline: Dhaka and Colombo have stressed accelerating negotiations over signing the Preferential Trade Agreement (PTA) at the earliest to unlock the untapped potential of bilateral trade between Bangladesh and Sri Lanka.

title: Ashen Senaratne eyes parliamentary seat through National List
byline: Social media activist Ashen Senaratne says that he expects to enter the Parliament through the national list in the upcoming General Election, although his nomination was rejected.

title: Petition against Ranjan Ramanayake’s nomination dismissed
byline: The Supreme Court today (30) dismissed a petition filed seeking an order to reject the nomination of former Member of Parliament Ranjan Ramanayake, who is contesting the upcoming general election under the “United Democratic Voice” party from the Gampaha District.

title: Sri Lankan appointed new Independent Chair of ICC Anti-Corruption Unit
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the appointment of Sumathi Dharmawardena P.C. as the new Independent Chair of the ICC Anti-Corruption Unit (ACU).

title: Court orders to recall arrest warrant against Upul Tharanga
byline: The Court of Appeal today (30) ordered to recall the arrest warrant issued by the Matale High Court against the Chairman of the Selection Committee of Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC), former Sri Lankan cricketer Upul Tharanga over failure to appear before the court pertaining to a match-fixing case.

title: Gammanpila accuses govt of misusing the law, to launch public petition
byline: Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) leader and former MP Udaya Gammanpila says that he plans to launch a campaign to collect signatures for a public petition, in order to inform the President of the public’s displeasure over the misuse of the law.

title: Colombo’s inflation drops to -0.8% in October 2024
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has decreased to -0.8% in October 2024, compared to -0.5% in September 2024, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Advisory issued for thundershowers and severe lightning
byline: The Meteorology Department warns that thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur at several places in Uva and Eastern provinces and in Hambantota, Polonnaruwa, Mullaittivu, Kilinochchi and Jaffna districts.

title: Petitions against waiving off EPF interest rates during debt restructuring dismissed
byline: The Supreme Court has dismissed four petitions filed seeking a ruling that the fundamental human rights have been violated through the government’s recent decision to reduce the interest paid for the investments of Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) in treasury bills and bonds to 9%, under the domestic debt restructuring process.

title: Railway Station Masters withdraw from ticketing duties
byline: The Railway Station Masters will refrain from all ticketing duties from 4.30 p.m. today (30), the Railway Station Masters’ Union announced.
